text: Infectious disease played an equally important role in past human migrations. The conquistadores' sweeping conquests of large swaths of the Americas in the 16 th century was greatly aided by the diseases they brought with them, such as measles and smallpox, to which the indigenous populations had limited immunity [22] . Conversely, one of the possible reasons Europeans managed to colonize Africa was that they used quinine, an antimalarial drug derived from the bark of the cinchona tree [23] .
